title: How to stop people from leaving spam comments on my Wordpress blog - Quora

response.answer_text: Spam comments are a big fact of Internet life. If you enable comments on your website, you have to deal with spammers. To prevent bad impression of your website, you need to find a effective ways to stop or prevent spam comment. Although you may not be able to completely eliminate spam comment but, you can reduce it. For WordPress users, there are a easy way to prevent spam comment. For this, you have to install Akismet Anti-Spam Plugin.  After install you have to set Akismet Anti-Spam Plugin API key to use it. Though the Keys of plugin are free for personal blogs; paid subscriptions are available for businesses and commercial sites. Main features of Akismet Anti Spam Plugin This Plugin automatically checks all comments and filters out the ones that look like spam.Each comment has a status history, so you can easily see which comments were caught or cleared by Akismet and which were spammed or unspammed by a moderator.URLs are shown in the comment body to reveal hidden or misleading links.Moderators can see the number of approved comments for each user.A discard feature that outright blocks the worst spam, saving you disk space and speeding up your site.You can take some more steps to fight with spammers. Here I am giving some extra tips for you. Just follow these steps given below: Create a list of ‘Blacklisted’ words for user commentReduce the number of hyperlinks allowed per postRestrict comment privileges to registered usersMove to a new comments system (like Disqus or Facebook)Set up a comment moderation systemI hope this answer helped you find useful tips and tools to combat spam comment in WordPress.

One of the most powerful ways to do this is to just install the CAPTCHA plugin. You can integrate it with your WordPress blog so that people have to solve the CAPTCHA to leave a comment. The great thing about this way of blocking comment spam is that it basically weeds out around 90% to 95% of all the spam out there. The truth is, most spam is automated. Flesh and blood human beings would not put in the time, effort, and energy to manually spam your blog. After all, your blog may be new, or people haven’t really heard of it, so it’s not really worth their time that the return on investment is not there. So they use all this sophisticated software, but you can stop those types of software in their tracks by installing spam comment CAPTCHA plugins. So go to Blog Tool, Publishing Platform, and CMS - WordPress, look up their CAPTCHA plugins, and you should be good to go.
